description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Verona" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Verona

places.generalDescription: Piazza delle Erbe, also known as Piazza Erbe, is a storied and historic town plaza located in the north of Verona. Surrounded by cafes and buildings with quaint architecture, it has been a trendy meeting point for locals and tourists alike. The square is bustling with life during the day, hosting a vibrant market where tourists can weave through the stalls. In the evening, it transforms into a souvenir market with bright lights illuminating the area.

sources.snippet: Another unmissable stop in Verona is Piazza delle Erbe, the city‚Äôs oldest square, which feels like an open-air living room. It‚Äôs surrounded by some of Verona‚Äôs most significant buildings: on the northern side, you‚Äôll find the Palazzo del Comune, Torre dei Lamberti, Casa dei Giudici, and Casa dei Mazzanti, while on the southern side stands the magnificent Palazzo Maffei. Here, stop for an aperitivo at one of the many caf√©s surrounding the square.
sources.shortName: Romantic Verona Itinerary: 10 Things to Do as a Couple in One Day

sources.snippet: From Piazza Bra you easily get to Piazza Erbe by crossing the town‚Äôs most famous shopping street Corso Porta Nuova. Between a shop and another you will easily end up in small lovely alleys from which you will get to see romantic views, perfect to be the backdrop of a day at the discovery of one of the most charming and romantic cities in Italy and in the world.
sources.shortName: Verona, romantic, historical, mysterious city

sources.snippet: This is one of the 5e best attractions in Verona, this square is one of the most picturesque places in Italy. It is on the site of the Roman Forum and is now a fruit and vegetable market. In the center of the Square is the Berlina, a four-column canopy formerly used for elections.

sources.snippet: In one corner of Piazza Erbe is Via Cappello where, just a short walk way, you will find the archway bearing the crest of the da Cappello family (a name which Shakespeare changed to Capulets in his play), through which is the courtyard of Juliet‚Äôs House.

sources.snippet: Piazza delle Erbe is the highest-energy square in Verona and is unique in so many ways. The square is the oldest in Verona in centro storico (the historic city center.) Another fun fact?. It was built over the ancient Roman forum.

places.generalDescription: The Arena di Verona is a well-preserved Roman amphitheater located near Piazza Bra in the city center. Built in the 1st century AD, it was designed to accommodate up to 20,000 spectators and has retained its original appearance. While not as famous as the Colosseum, it is a stunning piece of architecture with a rich history. In ancient times, it hosted traditional games and shows and later became a venue for events and parties under Scaliger domination.

sources.snippet: If you are in the city during summer, the best way to end the day is without doubt at the Arena or the Teatro Romano for a concert, a show or an opera, something of an institution here in Verona. And after the show, enjoy a candlelit dinner: there are many places in the city centre which stay open late, so that theatre-goers can round off their evening with an unforgettable dinner in the enchanting surroundings of Verona city centre. Lovers have always found something very special in Verona, a city where they can open their hearts to each other.
sources.shortName: Verona is so romantic!

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for something truly romantic to do in Verona on Valentine‚Äôs Day, watching an opera at the ancient Roman amphitheater, Verona Arena, is a must. Built in the first century, this open-air arena is still used for concerts and operas and offers breathtaking views of the city. The Verona Opera Festival takes place in the summer months, but the theatre often hosts special events around Valentine‚Äôs Day.
sources.shortName: Verona Italy on Valentine's Day: The 15 Most Romantic Things You Can Do

sources.snippet: The Arena di Verona, or Verona Arena, is the ancient Roman amphitheater that dominates the city center. Similar to the Coliseum in Rome, the round shape and hollowed-out windows. sources.snippet: Symbol of the city itself, the Verona Arena at sunset takes on a particular charm that cannot be missed. Attending an evening show or simply walking around the Arena at sunset is an experience that will remain in your heart.

sources.snippet: The arena in Verona is a quite impressive structure, especially if you consider the historic value. It was the last of the great buildings for entertainment purposes built by the Romans in Verona and is one of the best preserved ancient structures of its kind. This Roman amphitheatre can be found in Piazza Bra.

Enjoy a stroll through the picturesque and romantic Piazza Bra, the heart of the historic center, surrounded by shops, caf√©s, and restaurants. Then, explore the Arena, the symbol of Verona.

places.name: Arena di Verona

reviews.text:
Since we were in Verona, we had to visit the magnificent Arena. Unfortunately, we couldn't attend an opera performance this time. Still, the place itself is an incredible experience. Sitting on a stone bench that's 2,000 years old and imagining what it was like back then is truly special.

The day was hot, and there's naturally no shade in the outdoor areas of the Arena, so be prepared for high temperatures. Ticket prices are fairly high, especially considering there's not much to see beyond the Arena itself. It's best to buy tickets online-the line at the ticket office is long. We only realized this while waiting in line, but once we bought them online, we got in smoothly.

Seeing an opera here is something you must do at least once in your life!

Nice view from the outside, not very much extra inside. A lot of mechanical/modern machines which takes the charm away. We walked no longer then 20 minutes. A lot of money for this attraction, but feels obligatory when visiting Verona.

One of the most impressive structures to survive from the Roman era! Built in the first century AD, the Arena is a spectacular testament to the architectural power of the Romans. It was once used for spectacular gladiatorial fights, and today it hosts opera performances, concerts and special events. A visit to the Arena is like traveling back in time, an opportunity to experience history up close and marvel at the beauty and grandeur of the ancient structure. You are invited to dive into a world of culture, art and history, and enjoy an unforgettable experience.
The Arena is a huge elliptical structure, designed in pink limestone.
Watch an opera performance: The Verona Arena is known for its spectacular opera performances, which take place in the summer months.
Visit the exhibitions and guided tours, which will tell you about the rich history of the Arena and its various uses over the years.

places.generalDescription: Ponte Pietra is a picturesque Roman arch bridge in Verona, first constructed in 100 BCE and later rebuilt following its destruction in World War II. It's considered one of the city's most romantic symbols. The area around Ponte Pietra offers various attractions such as historical sites like Teatro Romano, Castelvecchio, and ancient churches. Additionally, there are elegant cafes, artisan shops, and high-end boutiques that contribute to the city's charming atmosphere.

sources.snippet: If you are near to the Ponte Pietra bridge, call in to one of the osterie on via Ponte Pietra,  where you can enjoy a class of wine on the terrace overlooking the river Adige. If you want to head for higher ground, cross the ancient Roman bridge, one of the most captivating places in the city along with the Ponte Scaligero, and take the funicular to the top. There waiting for you is castle San Pietro, the most romantic spot in the whole city.
sources.shortName: Verona is so romantic!

sources.snippet: The Ponte Pietra , with its Roman structure and view of the river, is undoubtedly one of the most romantic places in Verona. A walk at sunset on this bridge offers the opportunity to admire the golden reflections on the water and the city lights starting to light up, a magical moment of the day in which an intimate and evocative atmosphere is created, ideal for sensational photos.
sources.shortName: Verona at sunset: the most romantic places to admire the city

sources.snippet: You can also stroll along the Adige River and see the incredible Ponte Pietra, a Roman stone arch bridge, which is a perfectly romantic view. For an even better panorama, head up to the Castel San Pietro hill where an overlook offers a sweeping view across the city. While in Verona, you won‚Äôt want to miss seeing the Verona Arena, a Roman amphitheater from the 1st century.

sources.snippet: Crossing the Ponte Pietra bridge is a romantic activity that you simply cannot miss when in Verona on Valentine‚Äôs Day. places.name: Ponte Pietra

reviews.text: A striking Roman bridge dating back to 100 BC. Spanning the Adige River, it features elegant arches and offers picturesque views of the city and surrounding hills. The bridge beautifully blends history and charm, making it a must-visit landmark for anyone exploring Verona. Its serene atmosphere and architectural beauty provide a perfect backdrop for photos and leisurely strolls.

Strange to review a bridge, it does the job well at getting you from one side of the river to the other without getting wet. It is a pretty little bridge, amazing that parts of the original bridge from 100BC are still there! I thought it would be the paler stones that were the original but it turns out it is the darker, brown bricks, those Romans knew what they were doing alright

In Verona, which is full of beautiful and unique sites, the bridge and the surrounding sights are some of the most special in the city. In the immediate vicinity are good bars and some of the best restaurants in the city.

places.generalDescription: Castel San Pietro is a medieval fortress located on a hill overlooking the city of Verona. The fortress, built in 1398, offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding area. Visitors can reach the castle by taking the Funicolare di Castel San Pietro, a funicular railway that runs up to the hill. While entry into the castle itself is not permitted, many tourists enjoy walking through the beautiful tree-lined streets and capturing picturesque views of Verona from this vantage point.

sources.snippet: After lunch, I recommend crossing the bridge and visiting the Roman Theater and then walking to Castel San Pietro for a breathtaking panoramic view. You can access it by car, walk along a beautiful path next to the Theater or take the new funicular that will take you directly to the top. There are numerous restaurants in Piazza delle Erbe including Palazzo Maffei, a baroque palace whose top is adorned with six statues of Greek Gods.
sources.shortName: an itinerary for a romantic weekend

sources.snippet: No romantic journey in Verona is complete without an unforgettable sunset. Castel San Pietro is the city‚Äôs best sunset spot, easily accessible either by a walk up the steps from Ponte Pietra, or via a ride on the funicular which will bring you to your destination in just a few minutes. The view of the Adige river and the historic center at sunset will certainly become one of the most cherished moments of your stay in Verona.
sources.siteName: Hotel Indigo Verona - Grand Hotel Des Arts
sources.shortName: Verona in love: a romantic itinerary through the city - Hotel Indigo Verona

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a romantic activity on Valentine‚Äôs Day in Verona, then why not take a stroll to the top of Castel San Pietro?. Located on the hill above the city center, it‚Äôs the perfect spot to get a stunning view of Verona and its many romantic attractions. Once at the top, you‚Äôll be able to look out over the rooftops and the beautiful countryside beyond.

places.name: Castel San Pietro

reviews.text:
The Castel San Pietro is a historic fortress located near the historic centre of Verona. the hill: Colle San Pietro was first developed as a military fort in the 12th and 13th centuries with a current buildings on-site dating back to the mid nineteenth century, constructed during Austrian rule.

There was a lovely hike to the summit of Castel San Pietro, offering panoramic views down to the river and across all of Verona. I can certainly recommend a visit.

Fantastic spot to get a full view of the City of Verona. Stunning views. Small funicular railway takes you to the top where you can get lovely coffees, deserts and ice creams on a hot day. The peace and quiet up here is just what you need after leaving the city streets.

I highly recommend coming here just for the views. There was a musician playing the guitar by the name of Claudio Romano, and he played Corcovado so nicely that I bought his CD for 10 euro (see videos for sound). I parked here, and took an automated tram that allowed us to not have to hike up in hot weather.

places.address: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro, 2, 37129 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Porta Borsari is an ancient limestone gate dating back to the 1st century, serving as the main entrance to the city of Verona. The area surrounding it is rich in history, with medieval and Renaissance palazzos waiting to be explored. Visitors can also experience the romantic ambiance of Juliet's House and its beautiful Renaissance frescoes.

sources.snippet: The Roman city gate was once the main entrance of the city of Verona. The gate dates from the first century AD and stands on the site of an older gate. The white limestone gate is flanked by pillars and has twelve arched windows on the top floor.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Verona Travel Guide for New Visitors

places.name: Porta Borsari

reviews.text: What a great ancient gate dates to the first century , the amazing thing the gate still in a good condition üìúüòç
A beautiful wonder of the city. A feeling of reverberation in the heart to walk through it!

The second of the two Roman gateways to the old city still has both of its arches in tact  and the road through it leads to the original Roman Forum (Piazza Erbe). Unfortunately it has been covered over for repairs. View from pavement, no access charges open 24 hours.

places.address: Corso Porta Borsari, 57A, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ponte Scaligero is a historic bridge in Verona, Italy, with a rich past dating back to the 14th century. It features brick and marble construction with three spans and arches. The bridge was reconstructed after being destroyed during World War II, using parts of the original structure. Visitors can enjoy stunning river and city views from the bridge, as well as picturesque photo opportunities along its narrow walkway.

sources.snippet: If you want to head for higher ground, cross the ancient Roman bridge, one of the most captivating places in the city along with the Ponte Scaligero, and take the funicular to the top. There waiting for you is castle San Pietro, the most romantic spot in the whole city. The view over Verona from up here is spectacular, especially at sunset.
sources.shortName: Verona is so romantic!

places.name: Scaliger Bridge

reviews.text: A nice bridge with beautiful views of the city. The current bridge was re constructed after WWI. The bridge connects the historic Verona to the more modern one. A very idyllic place.

The Bridge is attached to the Medieval fortress, it has beautiful views of the river and city.

A must on your visit, whether your here for a week or just a few days.
Enjoy!

Picturesque red brick bridge spanning the Adige river.
Was built in 14th century but was destroyed by the retreating German army in 1945 and rebuilt using the same bricks by 1951.

places.generalDescription: Caff√® Borsari, located in Verona, is a renowned spot offering a wide variety of specialty coffees. The cafe has been serving its patrons since 1969 and is known for its excellent creamy coffee and freshly made brioches. The menu includes an extensive range of coffee options such as Kilimanjaro, Costa Rica, Oro Blend, and Supremo.

places.name: Caff√® Borsari

reviews.text:
One of the best choco (the intense chocolate  flavor) with whipped cream! It wasn't as heavy as it seems and the cup is also not too small (regular cappuccino cup size). One is good for my two girls to share. The espresso was just right (wonderful!).
I was skeptical after reading some reviews about the staff but they were very attentive and nice!!! We had a great break from the walk.
Hidden gem with real italian espresso! You can get a real experience by seeing locals popping by to have their espresso! Croissant freshly made! Price is unbeatable! Quick service!

I had the best pistachio croissant ever here! It was so good, so fresh and simply delicious! I've had many pistachio croissants, but this was the best one! I tried it fresh from the oven, it was so warm and so delicious. Also the coffee here is great too! I recommend!

places.generalDescription: In the heart of Verona's Old City, stands the impressive Torre dei Lamberti, a medieval tower built in 1172 by the influential Lamberti family. Rising to a height of 84 meters, it offers commanding views of the ancient city and its red-tiled rooftops. Visitors can climb this historic landmark for panoramic vistas over Verona.

sources.snippet: Then I found myself once again in the historic centre, staring up at the red and white patterned fa√ßade of the Torre dei Lamberti. Dominating what was once an ancient Roman Forum, Piazza delle Erbe, this 84 metre tower has 368 steps waiting to burn your quads and spike your heartrate. Or there‚Äôs the elevator, but I‚Äôm a stubborn one and like a challenge.
sources.shortName: Verona Travel Bucket List 2025

sources.snippet: Climbing the Torre dei Lamberti is also an unmissable stop on the romantic tour of Verona. With its 84 meters high, it offers a spectacular panorama, especially at sunset, when the evening lights envelop Verona in a luminous embrace. The tower is easily accessible and represents a unique experience to experience the magic of the city from above.
sources.shortName: Verona at sunset: the most romantic places to admire the city

sources.snippet: For whatever reason, I found myself more entranced by his flitting than anything I had seen earlier in the morning during a tour of the city‚Äôs 2,000-year old Roman amphitheatre or a visit to the Torre dei Lamberti, an octagonal bell tower in the main square featuring a mixture of Romanesque and Gothic architecture.
sources.shortName: A Quick Guide to Romantic Verona Italy

sources.snippet: High above the Piazza delle Erbe soars the unmissable Torre dei Lamberti or Lamberti Tower. You‚Äôll notice if you climb to Castel San Pietro or anywhere that looks over the city of Verona that the skyline is dotted by tons of towers and church bell structures ‚Äì the Lamberti Tower is the most famous.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best & Unique Things To Do In Verona, Italy You'll Regret Missing

sources.snippet: Another great viewpoint in Verona is the view from Torre dei Lamberti. The tower is located next to Piazza delle Erbe and just a short walk from the famous balcony of Juliet. With its 84 meters, the tower overlooks the city and offers a 360 degrees view.
sources.shortName: 20 Things to do in Verona

sources.snippet: One of the best tips to do in Verona is to climb the Torre dei Lamberti. As mentioned earlier, the tower dates from 1172, when construction started. How special is it to think that this square and the tower have looked the same for hundreds of years?

sources.snippet: Then, climb the Torre dei Lamberti, a 275-foot tower begun in the 12th century, to see the scene from above.

places.name: Torre dei Lamberti

reviews.text: Super tower,  not very expensive to go up. There are two ways up. You can use the lift, which takes a couple of minutes to get to the top or the stairs. There are about 400 steps up. But it's definitely worth the climb up. The views are amazing.  Definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to go up.

The Torre dei Lamberti is a 84 m high tower giving the best 360¬∞ views over the city. There is a lift which takes you up most of the way or you can do stairs(368). Due to the final climb, there is no wheelchair access.
Would suggest you book ahead to avoid the queues. Be aware bells ring every half hour!!
Take note, the whole observation deck has netting & wire mesh!

Amazing...the most impressive view of the beauty of the beautiful city of Verona. The place is wonderfully organized. Don't miss a visit to the local museum up the stairs to the palace at the base of the tower.

places.address: Via della Costa, 1, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Casa di Giulietta, also known as Juliets House, is a 13th-century gothic-style building in Verona that has become a popular tourist attraction. Although it was once owned by the Dal Cappello family and not the Capulets of Shakespeare's story, it still exudes an enchanting charm that captivates visitors.

sources.snippet: Where Copenhagen has the mermaid, and Brussels is proud of Manneke Pis, Verona also has a similar symbol for a fictional character: Casa di Giulietta. Verona is the setting where the Shakespeare story Romeo and Juliet took place. Casa di Giulietta is the house where Juliet supposedly lived.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Verona Travel Guide for New Visitors

sources.snippet: The square is also in the middle of so many famous monuments that characterize the city ‚Äì the Lamberti Tower, Casa di Giulietta, Arco della Costa. There is also a famous fountain at the square‚Äôs center called the Fontana Madonna Verona.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best & Unique Things To Do In Verona, Italy You'll Regret Missing

sources.snippet: Yes, there is a house called the Casa di Giulietta in Verona. No, Juliet didn‚Äôt ever live there. Romeo and Juliet are fictional characters and our sweet Juliet never actually set foot on that balcony looking for her Romeo.
sources.shortName: Verona's Romantic Inspiration from Romeo and Juliet

places.name: Casa di Giulietta

reviews.text:
Despite the crowd, visiting Juliet's House was such a special experience. The place radiates a unique charm, filled with romantic history and timeless emotion. Standing beneath the famous balcony felt like stepping into a living fairytale. What truly delighted me was the souvenir shop, absolutely beautiful, filled with lovely, thoughtful items that perfectly capture the spirit of Verona.
A must-visit for every romantic soul. ‚ô•Ô∏è

We stopped by Juliet's House while exploring Verona - it was cool to see the famous balcony and step into the romantic legend for a moment. The museum was closed when we visited, so we only explored the courtyard, which was still worth the visit.

It was very crowded, so don't expect a peaceful experience, but it's an iconic spot and a fun photo opportunity if you're already in the area.

Charming but very crowded! The courtyard with the famous balcony is lovely, but expect lots of people taking photos. Worth seeing for the Shakespearean vibe and romantic atmosphere. Book tickets in advance if you want to go inside the house.

places.address: Via Cappello, 23, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Caf√© Carducci, a charming family-owned restaurant in Verona, has been a local favorite since 1928. It's known for its cozy atmosphere and vintage decor, making it a perfect spot for a romantic dinner or a leisurely brunch. The caf√© offers an array of delightful options including piadina sandwiches and sfogliatina pastries. Whether you're stopping by for morning coffee or evening drinks, Caf√© Carducci is sure to provide a welcoming atmosphere and fantastic coffee.

sources.snippet: CafeÃÅ Carducci is a romantic and charming cafeÃÅ located in the heart of Verona. The cafeÃÅ has a unique atmosphere, with its vintage decor and cozy atmosphere. Enjoy a delicious dinner here with your partner and enjoy the romantic setting.
sources.shortName: Verona Italy on Valentine's Day: The 15 Most Romantic Things You Can Do

places.name: Caf√© Carducci

reviews.text: It has lovely interiors. I had salad, it tasted fresh and it had a tasty dressing. The Parmesan aubergine toast was good as well. The staff are friendly. I would recommend them.

I don't always feel compelled to write reviews but Cafe Carducci absolutely deserves one. This place was hands down the cafe highlight of my entire trip to Verona.

The coffee here is incredible - proper Italian espresso that actually tastes like coffee should. Their pastries are fresh, especially the cream and chocolate croissants which were perfect. You can tell everything is made with care.

What really sets this place apart though is the authentic atmosphere. It has that genuine traditional Italian cafe charm - not touristy at all, just real old-school character that makes you want to sit there for hours. The aesthetic is exactly what you picture when you think classic Italian cafe.

The service was great - friendly staff who made the experience even better. And honestly, the prices blew me away. So reasonable for the quality you're getting. On average paying ‚Ç¨6 for two coffees and two pastries.

If you're visiting Verona, seriously make time for this place. It's the kind of spot that makes a trip memorable. I ended up going back each day because it just felt so right.‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

Great ambience with lots of greenery and flowers on the street. Fantastic food. Loved the presentation of the vegetables. Was the best steak I've had in italy and a 20 year old wine that still had integrity was impressive!

places.address: Via Giosu√® Carducci, 10, 37129 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Trattoria al Pompiere is a cozy restaurant located in the heart of Verona, Italy. The dining room is adorned with old photos and offers a warm ambiance for guests to enjoy rustic pasta and meat dishes. The menu features a delightful selection of sliced cured meats, Italian cheeses, and flavorful dishes made from quality ingredients. With its central location, it attracts a large crowd, so making reservations in advance is highly recommended.

sources.snippet: Al Pompiere which literally translates to 'at the fireman' was opened over a century ago by a retired fireman who never chose to name the restaurant. This establishment has become a favourite with locals with its tasteful decor and finishing touches that make you feel quite at ease and welcome. It offers up typical Veronese dishes like pasta e fagiolle (pasta with beans), risotto and various meat options.
sources.shortName: 20 Reasons Why Verona Is The Most Romantic City In Italy

places.name: Trattoria al Pompiere

reviews.text: We were so lucky to get a table! After a month of enjoying Italy, this meal and service was up there with the best. We walked in on our first night staying in a nearby hotel, and it didn't take long to realise how wonderful and adored this place is. We enjoyed a sublime meal of duck ravioli, steak, and two out of this world desserts! We loved it so much, we tried hard to go the next night but it was fully booked. Book early and enjoy! We can't wait to go back.

Recommended by a friend who had been recommended by another friend! And for extremely good reason. The food was fantastic. The cheese selection was amazing if you like cheese! The beef tartare, pork knuckle and ravioli were stunning. The staff were lovely and knowledgeable. The place itself is extremely characterable. Completely recommend.

Incredibly delicious dishes absolutely everything we ordered and also excellent service üëçüèª They can easily replace mashed potatoes with vegetables due to tolerance and overall a professional approach!
I will definitely back here üòä

places.address: Vicolo Regina D'Ungheria, 5, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Re Teodorico is an upscale Italian restaurant located in a dreamy spot overlooking the beautiful city of Verona. It offers a mix of modern Italian cuisine and a stunning location with its Food & Garden area providing panoramic views. The terrace provides an ideal setting for al fresco dining or enjoying drinks and snacks throughout the day.

sources.snippet: After watching the sunset at Castel San Pietro, we recommend dining right there. Verona is full of romantic restaurants, but Re Teodorico is one of the best. It‚Äôs located right next to the castle and the funicular stop.
sources.shortName: Romantic Verona Itinerary: 10 Things to Do as a Couple in One Day

places.name: Re Teodorico

reviews.text:
An unexpected pleasant surprise.
You go to these places for the view. So it's always great when they also delivered on the food! I had one of the pizzas and it was delicious. Their wine list is also well chosen. I left well rested and ready for more exploration. Highly recommended.

Ps. The place has two sections (both with views). One area if you're only there for drinks, and another area if you're going for a meal (slightly nicer with white table cloth).

Definitely worth checking out. Grab a simple bite, soak in the peaceful atmosphere, and just admire the stunning cityscape. It's a proper little hidden gem for a bit of tranquility away from the hustle and bustle down below. Sure, the food and service are basic, but that view? Absolutely top-notch.
You're perched way up high, and the whole of Verona just sprawls out beneath ya. It's the kind of vista that makes ya just wanna sit there with a cuppa and take it all in for ages. I even spotted this tiny little courtyard down below with what looked like a secret garden ‚Äì proper charming! Definitely worth the trek up just for that panorama, even if your legs are burnin' a bit afterwards.
The menu's not massive, think more along the lines of toasties and maybe a pasta dish or two. I went for the simple and it did the job nicely. It's more about the chilled-out vibe and soaking in the scenery than having a fancy feed. The service was grand too, nothing overly fussy, just friendly folks handing your stuff over with a smile.

I recently visited Re Teodorico with my girlfriend to celebrate her birthday. We ordered two main dishes: The Pigeon and Rib braised in Valpolicella with puree. Unfortunately, our experience with the food was deeply disappointing. The Pigeon was already lukewarm when it arrived, and within just 2‚Äì3 minutes, it became completely cold - to the point where a visible white layer of fat had solidified on the meat. The second dish was no better - the rib was overcooked and dried out, lacking any tenderness or juiciness. I've attached photos to show exactly what we were served. To be fair, the staff was friendly and welcoming, and the view from the restaurant is truly beautiful. If you're looking for a spot with a scenic overlook, this place might be worth a visit - but I would not recommend it for the food. There are many other restaurants in the area with far better cuisine. Additionally, just across from the restaurant entrance there's a panoramic road with stunning views, perfect for photos and enjoying the moment - and it's free. In my opinion, Re Teodorico is overrated. The prices are far too high for the quality of the food we received. Had I known what to expect, I wouldn't have ordered these dishes even at half the price.

places.address: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro, 1, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Verona, Palazzo Maffei Casa Museo stands as a stunning testament to the city's rich artistic heritage. This elegant 17th-century mansion has been transformed into a captivating house museum that showcases an impressive collection of both ancient and contemporary art. Visitors are treated to an immersive experience where they can admire exquisite masterpieces while exploring the beautifully preserved rooms of this Baroque residence.

sources.snippet: There are numerous restaurants in Piazza delle Erbe including Palazzo Maffei, a baroque palace whose top is adorned with six statues of Greek Gods. In 2012, Piazza delle Erbe was awarded the most beloved piazza in the world.
sources.shortName: an itinerary for a romantic weekend

places.name: Palazzo Maffei Casa Museo

reviews.text:
A magnificent Palazzo standing at the head of the Piazza Delle Erbe fronted by the winged lion of Venice atop a tall column. The rooftop terrace offers a good view of the Piazza and close up views of the parapet statues of Hercules, Jupiter, Mercury, et al.
Inside is an intriguing collection of paintings, ceramics, furniture and antiques, all beautifully presented in exquisitely decorated rooms. Including some Picasso and Titian. It was a worthwhile and rewarding 2 hours.

Casa Maffei was a beautiful surprise in the middle of Verona's historic center. The museum itself is well curated, with stunning architecture and a mix of classical and modern art that gives a sense of how layered Verona's history is.

It was peaceful, not crowded at all - a great stop if you're looking for something beyond the main tourist sites. The view from the terrace on the roof is beautiful and offers a unique look at the piazza.

Highly recommend if you're exploring Verona and want a dose of art and elegance in a quieter setting. Get the audio tour on your phone for a few extra euros!

Very good experience! From the terrace you can enjoy the road to Romeo and Juliet full of people lining up. And the size is perfect for 1-2 hours tours. Staff at this museum super helpful. Audio guide is very helpful during the tour.

places.address: Piazza Erbe, 38, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Porta Leoni is an ancient gate in Verona, dating back to the Roman Republic. It boasts a double facade and two towers, offering evidence of ancient Rome's influence on the city. The gate was initially known as Porta San Fermo during the Middle Ages due to its proximity to a church of the same name. Later, it earned its current name from a nearby Roman sarcophagus featuring two lions.

sources.snippet: Continuing toward Leoni‚Äôs Gate (Porta Leoni) you will find a lot of restaurants where you can have a fabulous lunch. After your meal, be sure to visit Piazza delle Erbe with its market, the Madonna Verona fountain, and beautiful frescoes. Continue on to Piazza dei Signori, also known as Piazza Dante for its statue.
sources.shortName: an itinerary for a romantic weekend

places.name: Porta Leoni

reviews.text: I think this is one of the nicest gates in the city. I liked to see the ruins next to the gate, very nicely arranged for tourists and for viewing! My recommendation, if you want nice pictures, come here in the evening. We came at around 9:30 pm and it was perfect.

Porta Leoni is an old Roman structure that's been preserved. It's pretty much just a wall standing at a corner. Nearby is also an open area on the ground that'll give you a glimpse of the old structures that are now underground as the modern city was built on top.

The 2,000 year old remains of one the two city entrance gates to Roman Verona. Alongside the remaining archway are the foundations of the larger Roman gateway. The road from the gateway still leads directly to the original Roman Forum, now named Piazza Erbe. View from the pavement, no entry charges, 24 hour access.

places.address: Via Leoni, 37100 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Romeo Ristorante, Bistrot & Cocktail Bar is a bustling spot located in the atmospheric Sotto Salone market. It offers a fabulous selection of filled tramezzini, panini, and other snacks throughout the day. This is an ideal place to immerse yourself in the local dialect and interact with market workers and shoppers. The bar serves breakfast coffee, brioche, Falanghina, and later in the day, aperitivo with snacks.

sources.snippet: The land of amore and la dolce vita has been the setting for Italy‚Äôs great poet Dante and his beloved Beatrice, the 14th-century poet Petrarch and his unrequited love for Laura, and Shakespeare‚Äôs star-crossed lovers from Romeo and Juliet. Yet it is Romeo and Juliet‚Äôs tragic love story that has captured the hearts of romantics around the world.
sources.shortName: Verona's Romantic Inspiration from Romeo and Juliet

places.name: Romeo Ristorante, Bistrot & Cocktail Bar.

reviews.text: Fantastic staff, wonderful cocktails, olive chip Apertivo with the ability to buy additional tapas at about 3 euros each.  They also have a lovely menu. The ambiance is fantastic and we were recommended by a bartender who's from here and this is her favorite place.

One of the nicest bars we visited in Verona, tucked down between two main streets.

Staff were really friendly, the cocktails were fantastic and very reasonably priced.
Ask staff for suggestions as they are more than happy to help.
Highly recommend for drinks, didn't eat here so cannot comment.

We stopped there for a little aperitivo break during the day - and what a treat! The design of the place instantly reminded us of the White Lotus opening credits - elegant, artistic, and with a touch of drama. The cocktails were delicious, the small bites were exquisite, and the prices? Super reasonable. What more could you ask for? Perfect spot to unwind a bit in Verona after a long day of exploring. Highly recommend!

places.address: Vicolo S. Marco in Foro, 1b, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Antica Bottega del Vino is a prestigious and historic wine bar located in Verona, Italy. It has a rich history dating back to the sixteenth century and is currently owned by Le Famiglie Storiche, an association of long-standing Valpolicella families. The wine list is extensive, boasting around 4,500 wines from both regional and national origins.

sources.snippet: For a truly romantic experience in Verona on Valentine‚Äôs Day, why not visit one of the many wine shops (bottegas) for a tasting session?. Not only is it a great way to spend some quality time together, but it‚Äôs also an opportunity to learn about different wines and their origins. You can try some of the best wines from the Veneto region, such as Amarone della Valpolicella, Valpolicella Ripasso, and Soave.
sources.shortName: Verona Italy on Valentine's Day: The 15 Most Romantic Things You Can Do

places.name: Antica Bottega del Vino

reviews.text:
This should be a must in Verona if you enjoy wine. The list counts 180 pages of wines for all palates, budgets and occasions. If you are not sure, follow the sommelier's advice like we did. The staff is absolutely brilliant and kind!
If it wasn't enough, the food is also delicious, with a great quality and quantity price ratio. We had the risottos, the hen and the casunziei.

truly special place, steeped in history and full of charm. This traditional Italian trattoria offers not only incredible food but also an outstanding wine and champagne list. The passion for wine here is unmistakable. Be sure to ask for recommendations - the staff are knowledgeable and happy to guide you to the perfect pairing. An unforgettable experience for anyone who appreciates authentic Italian hospitality and exceptional wines.

We found the most delicious freshest food and the most exquisite wine (served in premium Riddle glasses) in Verona in this restaurant.
Highly recommended.

Thank you. Everything was great. ‚ù§Ô∏è

places.address: Vicolo Scudo di Francia, 3, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Teatro Nuovo is a charming and intimate theatre located in the heart of Verona. The atmosphere inside is enchanting, providing a magical experience for visitors. It's advisable to purchase tickets in advance for major shows, but same-day tickets are also available. The surrounding area offers plenty of options for dining and socializing at cafes, bars, and restaurants. The theater provides amenities such as restrooms and a service to store belongings for a small fee.

sources.snippet: If you are in the city during the summer, do not miss the by the Teatro Nuovo‚Äôs production of Romeo and Juliet, performed in the very locations in the city where the play is set. A unique experience!
sources.shortName: Verona is so romantic!

places.name: Teatro Nuovo

reviews.text:
Two households, both alike in dignity. In fair Verona, where we lay our scene... Whilst we have seen the Bard's most famous play in Stratford, home of the RSC, there is something even more special when seeing it played live on the streets of Verona.

The cast of Teatro Nuovo Verona staged a wonderful interactive performance. Starting at the casa de Giulietta we followed the story through to the rooftops of Verona, the church of their fated marriage, the Piazza and Torre where tragedy struck and onto the backstage of the theatre itself for the haunting and forgone conclusion.

Rather than follow the entire story, this play focused on the key plot points and filled the time between with audience participation and tour. We all danced (barely), sung (badly) and cheered (deservedly), whilst a few select audience members played their hand at imaginary swordplay (particular kudos to the lady who's death scene had everyone in tears of laughter).

Finally, the performers themselves... The two narrators were the driving force of the play, offering English and Italian dialogue seamlessly from one to the other. They helped guide and entertain us throughout, whilst occasionally joining in guest roles when needed. The Romeo and Giulietta we're captivating, humourous at the start and tragic at the end.

Highly recommended and thank you to the cast and team at Teatro Nuovo for a magical evening!
Small, but cozy and very well maintained. Don't expect top class ballet here, but you'll still enjoy the beautiful shows that come here from all parts of the world.

I watched the walking performance of Romeo and Juliet. It was an interactive experience, where you dance and sing. I really enjoyed myself. They were very welcoming and we had some drinks and snacks before the show and at the end they gave us an icecream. The actors were superb and the organization impeccable. I highly recommend it to all Shakespeare lovers.

places.address: Piazza Francesco Viviani, 10, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Signorvino Verona is a modern and inviting wine bar that offers a vast selection of wines and Italian cuisine, making it an ideal spot for aperitifs, lunches, and dinners. With over 1,500 carefully curated labels from both large and small Italian producers, guests can explore new wines with the assistance of a knowledgeable wine manager.

sources.snippet: Afterwards, head back towards Piazza Bra, where just a stone‚Äôs throw away you will find a lovely restaurant and wine bar, Signorvino. Here, order some delicious cold-cuts and cheeses or one of the daily specials such as riso venere with shrimps and zucchini, yummy!. And if you‚Äôre a wine enthusiast, you‚Äôve hit the jackpot, as you‚Äôll be surrounded by outstanding wine, champagne and prosecco bottles.
sources.siteName: Where To Go In | An Italiana's Guide To Travel & Lifestyle
sources.shortName: How to spend a romantic weekend in Verona

places.name: Signorvino Verona

reviews.text: Adorable restaurant chain offering superb Italian wines from all over the country, combined with delicious traditional food. Service is always above expectations and I never miss a chance to have lunch or dinner at Signorvino!

Overall, the experience was good. The ambiance, atmosphere was really good and the staff was really helpful. The wines were good and also in the soped there is free wine tasting.

They serve you bread before your meal arrives. The pastas were looking verygood but were average. If you are going to drink wine this is a good place.
cozy place, wine selection for all tastes. food is fresh. staff is friendly

places.address: Corso Porta Nuova, 2/A, 37122 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Enoteca Segreta is a charming and elegant restaurant in Verona, offering a modern twist on traditional Italian dishes along with an extensive wine selection. Tucked away in the backstreets of central Verona, this hidden gem provides a cozy and romantic atmosphere for visitors to enjoy. Guests can indulge in a delightful array of local delicacies paired with delicious wines. The restaurant also features an intimate and secret dining area in its cellar, perfect for a candle-lit dinner or a romantic evening out.

sources.snippet: But don‚Äôt forget to have made an advance reservation to the delicious Enoteca Segreta, because this restaurant cannot be missed on your romantic getaway!. Hidden away, Enoteca Segreta is the perfect place for an intimate dining experience. The dimmed lights and beautiful cozy design set the tone immediately.
sources.siteName: Where To Go In | An Italiana's Guide To Travel & Lifestyle
sources.shortName: How to spend a romantic weekend in Verona

places.name: Enoteca Segreta

reviews.text:
Loved it from the entrance till the last cafe cup. It's a little romantic restaurant with lots of mood lights! The food is absolutely delicious with a modern twist! It's so lovely to see how you can bring authentic Veronese dishes in such a modern and innovative way! The staff is superfriendly and sweet and wauw do they work fast ! I'm so glad i found this place i will definitely come back

Just as a tip: call for a reservation!

Love this place!!!
One of the most romantic and hidden restaurant in Verona. Great and authentic Italian menu, super knowledgeable staff.
Main courses are excellent but above all I recommend the cheese platter which is an explosion of flavours

A little secret restaurant we're glad to have found. Small and cosy with a great atmosphere, perfect for a date. An extensive wine list and great recommendations from the staff. Menu is small but everything was delicious, we shared a tasty cheese and prosciutto platter, pasta and veal dish and some great desserts.

places.address: Vicolo Samaritana, 10, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ristorante Antica Torretta, located in the heart of Verona's historic center, offers a romantic dining experience with its formal dining room and terrace. The restaurant specializes in traditional Italian cuisine, using fresh locally sourced ingredients to create creative Mediterranean dishes. Guests can enjoy tasting menus and wine pairings while indulging in dishes like seared tuna, crab ravioli, lobster spaghetti, and lamb chops in almond crust. The attentive staff ensures a delightful experience with their hospitality and kindness.

sources.snippet: Treat your sweetheart to a romantic dinner at Ristorante Antica Torretta in Verona. Located in the heart of the city‚Äôs historic center, this cozy Italian eatery is a perfect choice for a Valentine‚Äôs Day dinner. The restaurant specializes in traditional Italian fare, with an emphasis on fresh, locally sourced ingredients.
sources.shortName: Verona Italy on Valentine's Day: The 15 Most Romantic Things You Can Do

places.name: Ristorante Antica Torretta - Verona centro storico

reviews.text: We were staying nearby and had  chosen Antica Torretta months prior after looking at over 8 top choices. We had a lovely dinner and enjoyed all of our courses. The atmosphere was very romantic, with high beamed ceilings, low light, wonderful service. We will return !

A nice place overall. Portions were very small, but probably, we should have ordered different things, as the tables next to us got much bigger portions. The wine list is impressive, and the service is very good. I'll give it another try next time.

We had a wonderful experience at Antica Torretta last night. Service was thoughtful and passionate and timely. All of the servers made you feel like they wanted you to enjoy the experience. We tried some different dishes and flavors and were pleasantly surprised. All of the dishes were outstanding. Then, after dinner, it's only a 1 minute walk to the Ponte Pietra and fabulous views. Great restaurant and location.

places.address: Piazza Broilo, 1, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

sources.snippet: The Arco dei Gavi is one of the most stunning monuments in Verona and makes for a romantic stroll. Located in the Piazza Bra, it was built in the 16th century to celebrate the family of the same name, who had greatly influenced the development of Verona. The arch stands at a majestic 20 meters and its two statues of warriors symbolize strength and power.
sources.shortName: Verona Italy on Valentine's Day: The 15 Most Romantic Things You Can Do

places.name: Bepe Bigoi Verona - Pasta Fresca To Go

reviews.text:
We picked up three types of bigoli from Bepe Bigoi in Verona to take with us on the road as we left Italy and honestly, it was one of the highlights of our trip. We tried the Amatriciana, the duck sauce (Anatra) and the pesto - each one delicious in its own way.

The bigoli itself is something special: thick, slightly crunchy in that satisfying, oily, rich kind of way that makes each bite a real pleasure. It holds up perfectly for eating on the go, easy to twirl with a fork and enjoy while driving. I only wish I had picked up one more! Highly recommended if you're in Verona, whether you're staying or hitting the road.

If you're looking for a quick, tasty pasta to enjoy on the go or while soaking in the charm of Verona, this is the place to be. The flavors are just like authentic homemade dishes, and the pasta is made with care. Plus, the service is excellent! A must-visit spot if you're in Verona.

Excellent and simple eatery for those wanting to try traditional Bigoli Veronese pasta. There's five or six seats outside so you do need to find somewhere if it's busy. We had the bolognaise and seafood ones which were equally good.

places.address: Corso Porta Nuova, 18, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Statua of Dante Alighieri is a famous, rather pensive statue of the renowned poet standing on Piazza dei Signori in Cangrande's residence where he lived from 1312 to 1318. It was created by Ugo Zannoni in 1865 and stands as a popular tourist attraction. The statue portrays Dante looking lost as if he is taking in the sights and sounds of this lively city.

sources.snippet: The land of amore and la dolce vita has been the setting for Italy‚Äôs great poet Dante and his beloved Beatrice, the 14th-century poet Petrarch and his unrequited love for Laura, and Shakespeare‚Äôs star-crossed lovers from Romeo and Juliet. Yet it is Romeo and Juliet‚Äôs tragic love story that has captured the hearts of romantics around the world.
sources.shortName: Verona's Romantic Inspiration from Romeo and Juliet

places.name: Statua di Dante Alighieri

reviews.text:
While walking through Piazza dei Signori in Verona, I was surprised and honestly moved to see the impressive statue of Dante Alighieri standing tall in the center of the square. This statue was erected in 1865 to commemorate the 600th anniversary of Dante's birth, and it was sculpted by Ugo Zannoni, a Veronese artist. It's made of white marble and shows Dante in a thoughtful pose, with a cloak and laurel wreath, just as you'd imagine the father of Italian literature.

Dante wasn't born in Verona - he was from Florence - but he lived in exile here for several years under the protection of the Scaliger family after being banished from his hometown. That's why this city honors him with such a proud monument. The location is also incredibly symbolic: surrounded by historic buildings, arches, and just a short walk from the Scaliger tombs. It creates this strong connection between art, history, and politics of medieval Italy.

If you're a literature lover or just appreciate cultural landmarks, this statue is a must-see. It's not just a tribute to a poet - it's a piece of Italian identity, standing right in the heart of Verona.
Picturesque area around the city centre, old sculptures are always charming and the stories about the people they depict are also captivating.

The statue of Dante. His Divine comedy is really something, that you had alredy red. It is not that easy to read it, but it is something fundamental that teaches you about history and acient mind.... I wonder where we could meet us after life...

places.address: P.za dei Signori, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Osteria Enoteca Zero 7 offers good Italian cuisine at reasonable prices, with a slightly trendy atmosphere and a selection of high-end wines. Guests can dine on a small terrace and expect prompt service. The restaurant is slightly off the main thoroughfare but worth the visit for its amazing food and wine selection. It provides an authentic experience with open, friendly staff and a bustling local atmosphere.

sources.snippet: One of my happiest Verona memories is eating with my friend Franklin at a popular enoteca (wine bar). The carne cruda (raw beef) was, as Franklin put it, "the smile of a beautiful woman you can still recall after 10 years. You never forget her." The mortadella (Italian-style baloney ‚Äî not a high-end meat) was served with black truffle‚Ä¶and it was exquisite. (Is Spam also just a side-of-truffle away from exquisite?) Then came the best polenta I'd ever tasted, served with anchovies.
sources.shortName: Verona Is for Lovers by

places.name: Osteria Enoteca Zero 7

reviews.text: Walking around Verona and wanted to find a less touristy spot for lunch.  We ordered a salad and lasagna.  Salad was very good, lasagna was outstanding.  We sat outside on a very overcast day.  Their wine selection was excellent.  Wish it hadn't been our last day in Verona, we may have made a dent in their inventory..

Surprised find in a rainy day and we chanced upon this Enoteca based off review. The wines by glasses are awesome with so many grapes new to try, and the ravioli is So Good we ordered twice. Highly recommended

Food was almost decent but quite tasteless. Service was awful because it took them 80 minutes to bring our food. Atmosphere was really great and my favourite part. Overall I would recommend not going near this place if you don't want to wait hours and eat tasteless food.

places.address: Vicolo Ghiaia, 3, 37122 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Terrazza Bar al Ponte is a popular spot in Verona, offering a stunning view of the Adige River and nearby monuments. The modern interior and unique outdoor terrace create an inviting atmosphere for visitors. Whether you're exploring the town or attending an opera, this bar is open until 2 am, making it a convenient stop for brunch, aperitifs, or wine like Amarone. The terrace remains open year-round and features infrared lamps to keep guests warm during colder evenings.

sources.snippet: After exploring Verona‚Äôs streets, it‚Äôs time for an aperitivo, one of the city‚Äôs must-dos. There are plenty of great spots for a drink, but we recommend Terrazza Bar al Ponte. This beautiful venue overlooks the Adige River, right next to Ponte Pietra, Verona‚Äôs oldest Roman monument, with breathtaking views of Castel San Pietro.
sources.shortName: Romantic Verona Itinerary: 10 Things to Do as a Couple in One Day

sources.snippet: For a classic aperitivo with an unbeatable view, visit Terrazza Bar al Ponte. Located just a hop and a skip from Piazzale Castel San Pietro you can take a break from the midday sun with a riverside refreshment. Often aperitivo here consists of chips, peanuts, and finger food sandwiches, bruschetta, and some salumi.
sources.shortName: 20 Reasons Why Verona Is The Most Romantic City In Italy

places.name: Terrazza Bar al Ponte

reviews.text:
The view was breathtaking, and the ambiance was simply amazing. The staff was friendly and welcoming, despite the restaurant's busyness. Since there was no outdoor seating available, they graciously offered us a table inside until tables outside became available. Initially, they provided us with stools with a bar counter, which was convenient. However, when the outdoor tables opened, they offered to move us down to one of them, but we preferred the stools and bar counter.

I ordered a Coca-Cola and a Moscow mule, both of which were delicious. While we waited, they brought out small sandwich bites and chips with peanuts. For dinner, we decided to split a margarita pizza, which was perfect for two people and incredibly delicious.

The bathroom is located outside the back door to the right. It's a one-stall bathroom with a sink, but the line can get backed up as people enter and crowd around the sink.

Wonderful view on the patio. We loved the high table just outside on the left as it's the best view of the water. Pizza was wonderful and they were happy to make a Moscow mule even if it wasn't on the menu. Clean and modern bathrooms are a plus!

The ambiance of this place is everything I hoped for and more. Romantic yet somehow lively. Even with the rain, it was a perfect, romantic evening. Our server was so kind as to gift us an umbrella because we forgot to bring ours. I highly recommend adding Terrazza Bar on your destination list if you find yourself in Verona!

Advice For Americans
-one downside is that they allow smoking on the patio. I did not reduce stars for this because it is the norm in Italy, but I know we as Americans find it unacceptable, so I'm adding that in case it's a dealbreaker for restaurant choice if they allow smoking while eating.

places.address: Via Ponte Pietra, 26, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Osteria Sottoriva is located in a medieval arcade along the Adige river, offering a variety of dining options. Known for its slow service, the osteria stands out with its generous portions and affordable prices. The menu features dishes like braised tripe, creamy gorgonzola over polenta, and ricotta and spinach-filled crepes. This historic spot also offers a selection of locally-focused wines at reasonable prices.

sources.shortName: A Day In Romantic Verona: What To Do In The City of Love

places.name: Osteria Sottoriva

reviews.text:
We stumbled upon this place while walking in Verona. They say they're one of the oldest establishments in the city, which could be true considering they seem to have an authentic ancient wine cellar (see the photo).

Not a lot of variety in terms of food dishes, but they seemed very much local. We ordered the horsemeat and the pasta soup. Both were good. Service was pretty good as well, as we were done and out in about half an hour since we were on a time crunch.

We spent our first evening in Verona in this restaurant, having all around the north part of the old city we came across this and thought the menu looked good. The staff were very friendly but seemed to be quite busy, and we had to flag them down to order more wine.

We would describe this more as a wine bar that serves food. They have a good selection of wine as well as a fantastically priced house wine which was delicious. I was very grateful that it (red) was served cold.

We really enjoyed the three different cheeses aged at different periods., The contrast and tastes were delicious. In addition, we had the cold meats which complimented the cheese.

I had the lasagne, which could have had a little bit more meat inside. The lasagne sheets were light and dedicate.

Well priced, and a pleasant environment to spend an evening.

Portions are very small, pricey, although the food is great. The service was disappointing. Since I was alone, they were not happy with me at all. I was seated at a big table by a waiter, in a few moments the manager came to me and rudely asked to take smaller table.
In overall they pretended to be polite, but it felt fake. I decided not to order the dessert afterwards.

places.generalDescription: Via Giuseppe Mazzini is a narrow pedestrian street located in the heart of Verona's historic center, known for its array of designer boutiques and charming cafes. This major shopping destination boasts an impressive lineup of globally recognized brands such as Gucci, Louis Vuitton, and Dolce & Gabbana, alongside more affordable options like Zara and Bershka.

sources.snippet: After lunch, head to Verona‚Äôs renowned shopping street, Via Mazzini, filled with mainstream and high-fashion boutiques such as Armani, Trussardi and Furla, and don‚Äôt forget to stop by the department store, where all the designer brands are showcased.
sources.siteName: Where To Go In | An Italiana's Guide To Travel & Lifestyle
sources.shortName: How to spend a romantic weekend in Verona

sources.snippet: Then stroll along Via Mazzini, window shopping and stopping for ice cream or a delicious crepe with Nutella. Remember to look up along the way at the beautiful architecture towards Via Cappello. Juliet‚Äôs House is number 23.
sources.shortName: an itinerary for a romantic weekend

sources.snippet: Nonetheless, even if you don‚Äôt have the budget or need for Italian designer clothes, Via Giuseppe Mazzini is still one of the most trafficked streets in Verona to catch the latest in Italian style.
sources.shortName: The 15 Best & Unique Things To Do In Verona, Italy You'll Regret Missing

sources.snippet: Find these on Via Mazzini and in the Piazza Bra and snap an adorable photo with your sweetie below the glowing hearts.
sources.shortName: Spend Valentine‚Äôs Day in Verona, Italy‚Äôs Most Romantic City

places.name: Via Giuseppe Mazzini

reviews.text: A very vivid street, full of luxurious brands throughout the view! If you want to visit the main piazza, you will surely pass from this vibrant street. Not only it is quite aesthetic, but also quite handful given the candy shops, luxurious clothing shops, and restaurants, bars. A must-to-visit in Verona

Via Mazzini, Verona's wonderful shopping and entertainment street. Every theme is presented on the street in the highest quality. Even the ice cream parlors on the street are some of the best in Italy! The street connects the most important attractions of Verona - from Juliet's House and Piazza Erbe to Piazza Bra and the Verona Arena.

Unmissable street in Verona.
Artery connecting different important streets and famous places of the city

places.address: 37121 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Osteria Ponte Pietra Ristorante is a centuries-old space offering inventive regional Italian dishes and an extensive wine list. The restaurant overlooks the River Adige and the ancient Roman bridge, providing a romantic setting with evocative views of the city. The cellar boasts a sumptuous collection of Italian labels, Champagne, and selections from France, Slovenia, Germany, Austria, and New Zealand.

sources.snippet: This terribly romantic restaurant terrace had caught my eye before meeting up with Lorella, so I was thrilled that it had her local stamp of approval. Found at the start of the aforementioned historic Ponte Pietra and literally hanging over the river, the Osteria Ponte Pietra provides a seductive setting for the ideal romantic lunch or dinner in Verona. The menu of young chef Michael Silhavi features traditional Venetian cuisine with some contemporary twists.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic & Secret Places in Verona

sources.snippet: Intimate dining experiences are a must when you're on a sweet lovers' escape. "A super, super romantic dinner would be at this restaurant that has these little tables, again, in the Roman Arena area, with this tiny little terrace on the River Adige," said Bolla. "It's called Osteria Ponte Pietra. And, yes, locals go there.
sources.shortName: Seven ways to fall in love with Shakespeare's fair city of Verona, Italy

places.name: Osteria Ponte Pietra Ristorante

reviews.text:
It's right by Ponte Pietra, a beautiful scenic bridge crossing the river. It has a small outdoor patio seatings as well.

It's one of the more expensive restaurants I visited.

I had fresh pasta pappadelle. I would have loved to try the risotto but it requires minimum two people and I was traveling alone. The pasta was great and the kumquat gave it a unique taste.

For the main entree I had rhombus, turbot fish. It's an interesting taste and I wasn't sure if I liked it yet.

For dessert I had cheesecake. It was good but I wouldn't say it's special.

This restaurant is one of my absolute favourites in Verona - it is Michelin rated and the food and service is superb. Although pricey I recommend a meal here to treat yourself!

Set right on the river but if full there is extra seating outside on
the street side which unfortunately does not have a view of the river...

Just as an aside there is a fabulous clothing shop just opposite

Fabulous food, atmosphere, service, location, wine cellar. Even the loo is a spectacle (right in the basement)!

We had turbot and spaghetti (not together).

A little jewel of an eatery with a gorgeous view

places.address: Via Ponte Pietra, 34, 37121 Verona VR, Italy

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs a must in Verona: the picturesque inner courtyard of the Capulets‚Äô house, where visitors throng to see Juliet‚Äôs balcony. In reality, this balcony is not mentioned in Shakespeare‚Äôs work and the rare documents that might have attested to the actual existence of the lovebirds in Verona were burnt in a fire. After acquiring this 13 th-century former inn in 1905, it was the city council that had a balcony installed there in 1935.
sources.shortName: Verona: A romantic day in the city of Romeo and Juliet

places.name: A-M Apartments

reviews.text: Very cozy apartment, neat and clean. Quiet at night, no street noise. The kitchen has everything you could need for cooking. The hosts are friendly and helpful. When we arrived, they met us, showed everything, advised us where we could have a delicious dinner or buy great desserts, which we found left in the apartment when we arrived. I definitely recommend this great place.

(Translated by Google) Apartment very close to the hospital with a pleasant walk to the centre. I was there for almost two weeks. Apartment equipped with all comforts, warm, spotlessly clean and with everything you need to feel at home. Possibility to park without problems. Ariana is a wonderful, helpful and caring person. It welcomes you and makes you feel at home. Thanks for everything.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Verona, Studio P&M - Dottori Commercialisti stands out as a beacon of professionalism and expertise. Clients have consistently praised the firm for its exceptional consultancy services, highlighting their proactive approach to staying updated on tax regulations and financial opportunities. The team at Studio P&M is known for their clear communication skills, which foster a more personal connection with clients. Their reliability and courteous demeanor make them a trusted partner in navigating complex financial landscapes.

sources.snippet: Taking the pedestrian street Via Mazzini, you reach Verona‚Äôs Roman amphitheatre. It is one of the best preserved in Europe and the third largest in the world after the Colosseum and the Santa Maria Capua Vetere amphitheatre near Naples. Despite an earthquake in 1117, the structure is remarkably well conserved.
sources.shortName: Verona: A romantic day in the city of Romeo and Juliet

places.address: Via Roveggia, 136, 37136 Verona VR, Italy

places.generalDescription: Piazza Bra Arena A is the most central square in Verona and a must-visit destination. It's impossible to miss the iconic Roman Arena, which makes this piazza one of the city's most famous spots. Despite being a popular tourist attraction, it doesn't feel overcrowded due to its size. The area features historical buildings, a statue of Victor Emmanuel, and a garden with a fountain.

sources.snippet: Built in the first century (30 AD to be exact), the Verona Arena is a breathtaking must-see for anyone visiting Verona. In addition to being incredibly well maintained, you will be able to marvel with your jaw ajar at this ancient relic that housed at one time 30,000 people.
sources.shortName: 20 Reasons Why Verona Is The Most Romantic City In Italy

places.name: Piazza Bra Arena A

reviews.text:
Funny enough, there is no way to give a feedback for Piazza Bra on Google Maps, just this bus station (and I was denied adding the place). So, here we go:
This is one of the most famous Piazzi in Verona. And maybe the most popular, because of the Arena di Verona which sits right here on this piazza.

All the main bus lines stop here, so it's easy to get here (and getting back home). Even though there are loads of tourists, it doesn't feel overcrowded, just because of the size. You even can rest your legs at the small park here, it's quite relaxing. There are countless restaurants with nice views....but all the same (and lame) tourist menus. Good for a drink, but for good food head somewhere else.

From here you should walk along Via Giuseppe Mazzini, which is busy, but very charming and has some good shops.

So all in all a really nice Piazza, you'll get some nice pics here with the Arena in the back. And it's a good starting point for exploring Verona.

Very interesting part of Verona with the buildings on the Piazza itself, the statue of Victor Emmanuel, the reference to people who have died in WW II in the prison camps, the Roman Arena and the garden/fountain on the Piazza. A must to visit when in Italy.
Piazza Bra is a landmark of Verona where you can see and meet people from different nations. They come here because the historical importance of this place.
